papers.title: Highly efficient light-emitting diodes via self-assembled InP quantum dot films
papers.abstract_snippet: Heavy-metal-free quantum dot light-emitting diodes (QLEDs) face commercialization challenges due to low efficiency and poor stability... QLEDs with uniform and dense InP-based quantum dot films achieve high external quantum efficiency (26.6%) and luminance (1.4 × 10⁵ cd m⁻²), along with considerable stability (extrapolated T₅₀ lifetime of 4026 hours at 1000 cd m⁻²).
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: Demonstrates advances in InP-based QD-LED efficiency and stability critical for quantum dot display commercialization

papers.title: Highly efficient and eco-friendly green quantum dot light-emitting diodes based on interfacial potential-graded ZnSeTe quantum dots
papers.abstract_snippet: Eco-friendly green LEDs based on interfacial potential-graded ZnSeTe quantum dots demonstrate peak external quantum efficiency of 21.7% at 520 nm... The average EQE for control QLEDs is 10.5%, whereas QLEDs based on IPG QDs achieve 18.6%.
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: Addresses critical challenges in green QD-LED performance for full-color quantum dot displays
